website_summaries.verdict: With this pineapple flavored, nondairy soft-serve mix, you'll feel like you're living on an island.
pros: Great soft-serve choice for restaurants, small shops, and convenience stores
Essentially fat-free, with only a tiny bit of coconut oil
Nearly 90 half-cup servings from one bag of mix
cons: Some buyers complained about the product's taste and texture

customer_reviews.title: A hit with the kids!
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to find this product. I spend $5 for a 4-oz cup of this yumminess at the movie theatre, so this will save a lot of money. It is a big bag that is supposed to made at once, so I had to experiment a bit for the best consistency. I found that 8 ounces of the mix (by weight on a kitchen scale) plus 28 ounces of cold water worked great. I run the ingredients in the blender and place them in my 1.5-quart Cuisinart ice cream maker for 25 minutes. I then freeze the results for an hour. The outcome is the perfect texture. The only thing missing is the swirls. :)
customer_reviews.author: GL

customer_reviews.title: It really is just like at Disneyland!
customer_reviews.text: It's delicious! I looked at the reviews, and being that I didn't want to make 2 gallons, the recipe I went with was 1 cup mix to 3 cups ice water. Near the end of the mixing it was practically about to come out of the top of the machine. I also bought the Cuisinart ICE-45 Mix It In Soft Serve 1-1/2-Quart Ice Cream Maker, White sold here on amazon to make it. I love the machine. The mix is amazing! Now I can make it whenever I like, and My buddy ordered some to make as well. LOL *dances to the Tiki Room song playing in my head*
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: Just like Disney theme parks!
customer_reviews.text: This is the same mix used at Disney theme parks and you will get perfect results with these easy directions. Mix 10 ounces of dry mix into 18 ounces of cold water. Stir until completely dissolved, about 2 minutes. Add another 18 ounces of cold water for a total of 36 ounces and stir for 30 seconds. Immediately pour into 2 quart ice cream maker and turn the machine on. 20 to 25 minutes later it's done. DO NOT add milk, half and half or anything else except water if you want it like Disney serves. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: James R Finley

customer_reviews.title: So amazingly good, creamy
customer_reviews.text: Oh my! So amazingly good, creamy, tangy. Just like being in Hawaii or Disneyland, but for pennies! Went through several recipes and here is the best and easiest....one cup mix to 2 cups water. Mix and chill in fridge for at least two hours. Stir it up well, Then put in in the ice cream maker for 20-30 minutes. Perfect. Tried other recipes using milk and not as good as this. The chilling part really makes a difference, so don't skip that step.
customer_reviews.author: catover314

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful stuff!
customer_reviews.text: If your looking to recreate Dole Whips from Disney, this is it! The real deal. Mixes up very easily and comes with instructions for 1.5 and 2 qt machines, so your not stuck doing math to downsize the large servings. I ran it through my soft serve ice cream maker and on my first bite, I closed my eyes and experienced the sheer yumminess of Disney and Dole. I was magically transported to Adventureland, I could feel the hot Florida sun on my head as I tasted that very familiar pineapple flavor. I can hear the Disney jungle music and the the birds singing in the Tiki Hut. Heaven in a bowl.
customer_reviews.author: D. Russell

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is AWESOME!!! So happy to find the mix for the pineapple ice cream I learned to love in Hawaii!!! The only issue is it makes 2 gallons at once....and I only have a 2 quart ice cream freezer! So, I had to sit down and figure out the measurements to make small batches. Here' s my portions. 8 oz mix to 2 cups water....mix well, add water to measure 4 cups. Add to ice cream freezer for about 20 minutes. It is great!
customer_reviews.author: Humnbrd

customer_reviews.title: Best soft serve available! Disneyland Dole Whip!
customer_reviews.text: This is Dole Whip. Yes, it is Disneyland Dole Whip. Yes, it tastes like heaven! We have used this for years in our soft-serve machines. Beware, it is expensive compared to standard flavors!! Almost triple the price! It is hard to make a profit, but tastes great! Caution: DO NOT MIX WITH MILK! This is a lactose free, vegan friendly mix. It is intended to be used with water. Do NOT listen to others saying they used milk. I've tried and it curdles and clumps the mix. You also risk serving lactose to people who chose this product specifically because they have allergies that this does not contain. It is a great mix when used correctly- which is water only.
customer_reviews.author: Smokey

customer_reviews.title: amazing great flavor
customer_reviews.text: Used 1 3/4 cup of soft serve mix, plus 2 cups of water, mixed for 2 minutes, two more cups of water, mixed again, 20-25 minutes with 1.5gl ice cream machine, amazing great flavor. Put the rest in the freezer, pull it out for 10 minutes and scoop more then next day for a second bowl.
customer_reviews.author: John Duncan

customer_reviews.title: YES! It's Dole Whip!
customer_reviews.text: The only drawback is that their recipe calls for making the entire bag. I found that if you mix it 1 to 1, it tastes best. Example 1 cup of mix to 1 cup of water or if you prefer, 1 cup of mix to 1/2 cup of water and 1/2 cup of heavy cream (the later tastes best). If you have a blender, you can short cut the freezing process by substituting ice for water. A little more ice/liquid won't make a huge difference as it's pretty sweet.
customer_reviews.author: 5MIN2GG

customer_reviews.title: Just like Disney. Here is the ratio to make smaller serving.
customer_reviews.text: Just like Disney’s! Even stays soft when you freeze leftovers. To make smaller serving, here is the proper ratio: 1 cup of mix to 4 cups of water. This will make 8-10 servings.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Jones

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Not eligible for return . Plus u have to use a Dole machine to make it .. sorry I bought it plus they aren’t clear when u buy it that I can’t return it
customer_reviews.author: Mary Mullaney

customer_reviews.title: Whisked 1c dole mix with 2c ice water added 1c ...
customer_reviews.text: Whisked 1c dole mix with 2c ice water added 1c half and half 1c pineapple juice, whisked. Used cuisenart ice cream maker. DELICIOUS.
customer_reviews.author: KelsBoots

customer_reviews.title: Tastes like a strawberry sorbet
customer_reviews.text: I have a compressor ice cream maker and usually add 3 cups water to 1 cup mix. The mix is fairly forgiving with measuring. Making a real sorbet would take hours, this can be done in 30 to 40 minutes. Tastes well with strawberry soda for an all strawberry float. Price might seem intimidating but it's enough for 3 gallons of prepared soft serve mix. Well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: UnlikelyPotato

customer_reviews.title: Found the perfect recipe
customer_reviews.text: Enjoyed greatly, will say I followed recipe 1 3/4 mix to 2 cups. Bad idea. Made it like marshmallow, like another reviewer had posted. This time I did 1 cup of mix and 2 cups of water. Came out perfect. I did freeze it afterwards to make the perfect constiency. I will make a double batch next time. Shipping was great and fast. I own a kitchenaide with an ice cream attachment. I froze bowl prior for 24 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This arrived earlier than scheduled. I made a small batch in my counter too ice cream machine . (The regular kind not a soft serve machine). 3 cups liquid (I used a mix of mostly 2% milk and a bit of water.) to 1 1/2 cups powder. Most people say one cup but it seemed weak tasting so I added more. It was delicious. We put the extra in the freezer and I preferred it that way the next day. It was soft enough to scoop and not rock hard like some get. We will definitely be buying again and trying the other flavors.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy’s

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! Just like Dole Whip at Disneyland
customer_reviews.text: After visiting Disneyland and coughing up $7 for a Dole Whip float, I knew there had to be a better way to make it at home. It was suggested to use this product on a blog instead of trying to mix and match ingredients on other people's copy cat recipes. This was hands down amazing. It is a BIG bag and only took about 16 oz for my 2qt ice cream maker. But it's worth the price. It was easy to make, took about 25 min plus 5 min prep and so good! Just like the real thing. My boyfriend was hooked! So refreshing. Worth the buy!
customer_reviews.author: Phoenix

customer_reviews.title: Just a good as at Disney World
customer_reviews.text: Got this to make Dole Whip, like down at Disney World. Looked for recipes on the net and amazon and put them together. Here is what We use: 1 and a quart cups of Dole Whip Pineapple, Mix whisk into 3 cups of cold (ice) water and refrigerate for 30 minutes. We use a Cuisinart ICE-45 Mix It In Soft Serve 1-1/2-Quart Ice Cream Maker. This tastes just like Dole Whip at DW as we had some down there yesterday. Store the extra in a freezer container, it will firm up a little but will still be great, hours later if it lasts that long.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tastes just like Disney’s Dole Whip
customer_reviews.text: When I made this in my ice cream maker it only took about 12 minutes. I did add some 2% milk to make it creamier and added some fresh pineapple that I had put in the blender. It was absolutely delicious. The only thing I was disappointed in was the shipping of the package. When I received it part of the mix came out of the bag so there must’ve been a hole in it. Luckily it was less than 1/4 of a cup.
customer_reviews.author: Lynnt

customer_reviews.title: Customer service A+++
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the lime flavor, received pineapple in the mail. While not the END Of the world, it’s not what I ordered, so contacted Amazon and had the correct flavor shipped to me the next day at no extra charge. Excellent customer service. Product was as expected. If you’re using with a home ice cream machine, sub 1/2 c if the water with 1/2 c coconut milk—it will give you that creamy soft serve texture you’re looking for while maintaining the dairy free aspect of the treat.
customer_reviews.author: cDub

customer_reviews.title: This big bag will last me all summer
customer_reviews.text: This Dole Whip mix is exactly like the sweet summery treat that people stand in line for at Disneyland. Only you can have all you want at home in 20/25 minutes. I sometimes make it according to package directions but will often use half water and half milk for even more BAM!. This is so delicious and pineapple makes it the perfect flavor to add to drinks, top with fruit sauces or just have plain. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Disneyland Dole Whips got less special but who cares
customer_reviews.text: This is the stuff- I use a Cuisinart soft serve maker and follow the 2 3/4 water to 7/8 powder blend for about 23 minutes and it comes out well. Texture is always best straight out of the mixer; once it's in the freezer for a while, it can go crystalline and too hard, which depletes the flavor and definitely kills the 'whippiness'. For those who love Dole Whip and are tired of making the trip to Menchie's (or Disney or the Dole Farm or whatever), this is the way to go. It's a bit pricey up front but certainly more cost-effective than buying retail.
customer_reviews.author: k

customer_reviews.title: Almost like the Dole Whips at Walt Disney World
customer_reviews.text: It leaves a bit of an aftertaste, almost like a fake sugar does. It has a pineapple flavor, but seems less astringent than the ones we have gotten at WDW. I followed another reviewer's 'recipe' of 1-1/8c. mix to 3-1/2c. water, so that may account for the taste variance. Super easy to use. Mix the water and the mix, chill to 45 degrees F, and put in ice cream maker. I used my Cuisinart 2 qt maker, pulled it out at 20 minutes, when it was still soft, and put in the freezer to 'cure'.
customer_reviews.author: Jedana

customer_reviews.title: YUM!
customer_reviews.text: It's exactly like what you get from Disney. I'm SO glad this popped up when I was looking at ice cream makers! I've been trying to make homemade versions that were never right. Finally got my bag and used the directions someone posted in the reviews and it worked like a charm. Super easy to mix together and the old fashioned type of ice cream maker worked in making it too. The texture was a little too airy.. like my ice cream maker whipped too much air in to it, but not a huge problem b/c the flavor was on point. Delicious and oh yes.. I will be buying more when we run out!
customer_reviews.author: LS2018

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Delicious!
customer_reviews.text: I use a cup and a table spoon with four cups of cold water in my ice cream machine on sorbet and it’s absolutely amazing. Add a little pineapple juice in the bottom of the bowl before serving and it’s like being at Disney again. Love this soft serve.
customer_reviews.author: L. A. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Did someone say Rum?!
customer_reviews.text: I stumbled across this mix while looking for an ice cream maker. I felt like I hit the jackpot, well cause I've only had this in Hawaii and Disney!! So I made my first batch per recommendations on here...you can tweak it to your liking...and I did!! .....I mixed 1 cup mix (7 oz) with 2 cups of water and 1 cup of Rum! Yummmy! I bought the popsicle bags and now I have adult ice pops! This is a make ahead recipe since the alcohol won't let it freeze right in the ice cream maker, but its worth the wait! Enjoy!!
customer_reviews.author: Loveshopping

customer_reviews.title: Expiration dates!!
customer_reviews.text: Please be aware of the expiration dates. My bag arrived in September, with an expiration date of November. I did not plan on using it all at once and wanted to treat the kids throughout the holiday season, which won't work with such a quick expiration date.
customer_reviews.author: hsmom

customer_reviews.title: Now I see what all the fuss was about...
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is AMAZING! I mixed up a batch in a mason jar and put it in the fridge overnight, while I waited for my Cuisinart freezer container to freeze up. Poured it in the frozen container next day, turned on the machine and in 15 minutes I had some of the most amazing soft serve pineapple sherbet I've ever had. Highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Pushindazees

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: This is so so good! It really does taste like Disney to me! I was so excited to get this and was a little worried that I would be disappointed. But this did not disappoint at all. I love pineapple flavor and this has plenty of that flavor. It doesn't have any fake taste either. It keeps well in the freezer too (meaning it doesn't get rock hard or too icy). I like to kind of chop it up a little and then put in the microwave for 8 seconds to soften it back up a little after it has been stored in the deep freeze.
customer_reviews.author: Robin D.

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with I received it yesterday and they say I’m not able to return. I’m surely not eating something that Could have been tampered with
customer_reviews.author: Karen johnson

customer_reviews.title: Too sweet
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never been to Disney, but have heard about how amazing these dole whips are. So I did some googling and found this soft serve. I made it, it freezes up well in the ice cream machine (soft serve style) but I couldn’t even eat a bite. It tastes like you’re eating spoonfuls of sugar. It’s revoltingly sweet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for us
customer_reviews.text: I was really hoping this would be good. It has instructions for using the whole bag but not smaller batches. I used the same recipe I use for another soft serve. It didn't work. It turned into soft serve just fine, but the taste, yuck. This could be since it didn't have small batch instructions and I did wrong measurements or it could just be the taste. It leaves a weird taste in your mouth. You're better off making vanilla and adding strawberries.
customer_reviews.author: amanda

customer_reviews.title: Hole in the bag
customer_reviews.text: There was a hole in the bag when it arrived, and powder loose in the box. Others have posted that they were unable to return a bag that arrived with a hole - so I am not sure if I am going to even try, what with everything that is going on right now. But this seems to be an ongoing problem, And it is very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: I was skeptical, but this is the real deal!
customer_reviews.text: Made this dole whip today in my 1.5 quart Cuisinart soft serve machine and the result was amazing. Ratio is 7/8 cup mix to 2 3/4 water. Chill the mixture beforehand and make sure your ice cream sleeve is super frozen solid (I suggest 36 hours). Made Dole Whip floats with Dole pineapple juice and tastes exactly like what you get at Disneyland. For those craving a Dole Whip fix, this is it!
customer_reviews.author: Irene Adler

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic go-to for frozen treats
customer_reviews.text: A bag is slightly expensive but per serving the cost is super cheap. Taste is unique, delicious, and only needs water. This is awesome to keep in the cabinet for when you want to serve something delicious. Strawberry version is good with strawberry fanta for floats, pineapple with pineapple fanta is just a bit too strong.
customer_reviews.author: UnlikelyPotato

customer_reviews.title: awful
customer_reviews.text: Just made it with my ice cream maker by adding one cup of the mix and 3 cups of cold water. It tasted awful. It had a consistency of soggy sponge. Did I get a bad batch? It had really bad chemical after flavor. My daughter thought it was bad too. I ended up throwing out the whole batch. I wanted to return this but looks like either the seller or Amazon doesn't allow it.
customer_reviews.author: Mon K

customer_reviews.title: Tastes great
customer_reviews.text: I just wish they had instructions for consumer size machines on the packaging. With a Disney employee living here and approving, I can certainly say it tastes exactly the same as the real thing. I recommend stirring the mix with water and putting that in the freezer for about an hour before pouring that into your soft serve machine. You want your mix as cold as possible without completely freezing so it can be rich and creamy.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: It's Dole Whip Y'all
customer_reviews.text: Nostalgic for the days of visiting Disney, before the pandemic, I bought a bag of this soft serve mix. I don't have a soft serve machine, but mixing 1/2 C mix to 2 cups water (the ratio they recommend) I was able to mix some up in my ice cream maker! Unlike ice cream, you have to eat it right away to get the right consistency. It gets too hard in the freezer, but it's still delicious!
customer_reviews.author: Trafficone

customer_reviews.title: A Taste Of The Enchanted Tiki Room, At Home!
customer_reviews.text: Just like at the mouse house - instructions for smaller batches are not provided, but I’ve done the math for you! One part powder *by weight*, to three parts cold water. Whisk to combine, and refrigerate until cold before churning - while this step isn’t necessary for professional equipment, it *is necessary* for consumer ice cream makers, either compressor, frozen cylinder or ice+salt.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Tastes just like Disney!!
customer_reviews.text: Love Disney Dole Whips. It took a few tries to get this to work but we finally figured out what worked best. We have a Cuisinart 2 Qt Ice-Cream Maker. We used 1 cup mix to 2 cups water. Make sure to chill the mix first for a few hours. Came out great. Just like Disney.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Hogan

customer_reviews.title: Tastes just like Nando’s!
customer_reviews.text: I am glad that we found this mix. To make about 1.5 quarts in your ice cream maker: Measure 8 oz (1 cup) of Dole mixture and 2 cups water. Follow ice cream maker directions. We store the extra soft serve in a container. We are not ordering alot of food that’s not cooked or public drinks during COVID. What a great treat!
customer_reviews.author: Lexi B

customer_reviews.title: Best cool treat ever!
customer_reviews.text: If you haven't been to Disney and had this Dole Whip, you've missed one of the great frozen treats of all time! I bought a small ice cream maker and this product freezes up perfectly and tastes exactly like what you find at Disney or on Maui. The grandkids love it and so do friends. For potluck meals with neighbors in the summer I take the ice cream machine and make up a batch of this and folks can't get enough. It's pineapple better than you've ever experienced before!
customer_reviews.author: BuffyWatson

customer_reviews.title: Simply the Best!
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite Disneyland treat of all time. Let me tell you, it tastes just like what you would get at Disneyland. I didn't realize they sold it online until I was on an Instant Pot blog. I use the method where you use 1 cup of water and 1 cup of milk. Otherwise it's got a weird texture. The flavor is amazing and I will buy this over and over again.
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: Just like at Disney California Adventure!
customer_reviews.text: One of our favorite treats at Disney California Adventure is a cone from the “Adorable Snowman Frosted Treats”. This mix is exactly like those lemon cones! Mixed up in my Cuisinart and put in a pastry bag to fill the cones for aesthetics. If we could only make the blue slushy like their parfait! Definitely keeping this on hand!
customer_reviews.author: Cbarr

customer_reviews.title: Past expiration date :-(
customer_reviews.text: The bag I received is expired :-( My kids were so disappointed we couldn’t make it.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Jandron

customer_reviews.title: Tastes Incredible !!!
customer_reviews.text: While looking for the Pineapple Dole Whip mix we get at Disney I ran across this one. My family loves it !! It did not come with home portion measurements but the Pineapple one did and there are several available online. We make it with half cold water/half 2% milk and it turns out fantastic !!
customer_reviews.author: Mike C.

customer_reviews.title: Good flavor & easy to use; just too sweet for me.
customer_reviews.text: This mix was very easy to use but was too sweet for my taste. I used a mix of water and 2% milk. When I try it again I will try using 1% milk to see if that makes it less sweet and if that doesn't work I will use all water.
customer_reviews.author: leahabtx

customer_reviews.title: Peter Pan float in sunny Arizona!
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly the same as the Dole Lime whip floats at the Magic Kingdom! My son is allergic to dairy and for the price this is the least expensive frozen summer dessert that we have found. Now all I need is a dairy free chocolate feather.
customer_reviews.author: Bzymom

customer_reviews.title: The Same as Disney
customer_reviews.text: Want to recreate Disney's Dole Whip? This is it. We mixed this 1 parts mix to 3 parts water and made it in a. We might bump the ratio up to 1:5:3 for the next batch but it was pretty close off the bat. We tried the You Tube clone "recipes" and it was never the same. This 4.4 lbs bag will last you a LONG time.
customer_reviews.author: retro.joe

customer_reviews.title: Great flavor, older ice cream machine would not get right consistency
customer_reviews.text: well, the flavor is awesome. Just like you expect....we could not get the consistency right with our older Krups ice cream machine. So....we added vodka and made slushees......yep! Perfect. I will try again with a newer machine.....
customer_reviews.author: NAD

customer_reviews.title: Don’t need Disneyland to get Dole Whips
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly the Dole Whip you can get a Disneyland. The bag is industrial sized so it’s way bigger than one person could need but sizing down to a 1.5 quart ice cream maker requires only one cup of mix per batch. I’m ecstatic with how it’s turned out; now I’d like to see how the other mix flavors turn out.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Castro

customer_reviews.title: So I’m glad it’s available
customer_reviews.text: It’s exactly what you think it is. Dole Whip. The package should have home instructions on it and be resealable however. But I assume it was made for retailers, not home use. So I’m glad it’s available. The flavor and color are good. The texture is just a little odd due to the thickener added, but I’m sure the original is probably that way too.
customer_reviews.author: B. Bock

customer_reviews.title: Best thing ever
customer_reviews.text: I had my first Dole Whip in Hawaii in 2019 and have craved them ever since. The knock-off recipes on social media or the internet just aren't the same. We have a soft-serve ice cream machine, so it makes it easy to serve some up on a hot summer day. Even better with fresh pineapple on top!
customer_reviews.author: Channa Pender

customer_reviews.title: Delicious when you figure out the portions
customer_reviews.text: We did the math, and the correct recipe is 1 part mix to 2 parts water. It tastes just like Dole Whip at Disneyland for a fraction of the cost. I gave the ease of use only 3 stars because you do have to figure out how to make it in smaller portions, but the flavor is spot on. I have bought 2 bags in less then a month. My family loves it
customer_reviews.author: LLPRESCHOOL

customer_reviews.title: Dole Whip!
customer_reviews.text: It is just as described...soft serve pineapple mix. Easy to prepare and make at home in your ice cream maker. It is packaged for commercial use and did not come with smaller batch instructions as some other reviewers stated they received. But I was able to find the correct water to mix ratio online (and I think someone has posted a photo of their instructions on Amazon). It is much more cost effective than buying Dole Whip/float at Disneyland/World. Although, eating a Dole whip after standing in lines all day in the heat has a more satisfying effect than just having it at home!
customer_reviews.author: Shobana

customer_reviews.title: ease
customer_reviews.text: I was on the internet and came across this I have a Gourmia GS1400 I have been making my ice cream from scratch it is laborious especially when you have a family of ice cream lovers I bought the strawberry and it is delicious fast ,easy and affordable. now that I've tried it I will purchase by the case I love it that much. PS. try mixing with heavy cream instead of water. delish!
customer_reviews.author: deborah wilkerson

customer_reviews.title: Easy and delicious...
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a present for my daughter and 4 grandsons. Thought they would enjoy it especially after visiting Dole Maze and Plantation on Oahu. They loved it (and so did I). It's not exactly the same, but close enough to really enjoy. The price was great considering we made so many batches and still have some left. We will definitely buy more when this is gone.
customer_reviews.author: d. d.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: So happy I purchased this! Tastes exactly like the dole whips at the Dole Plantation in Hawaii and at Disneyland! I did a 2 cup water, to 3/4 cup mix in a 1qt ice cream maker and it came out perfect in 20 minutes!
customer_reviews.author: Beezy

customer_reviews.title: Just like the real thing
customer_reviews.text: wait this is the real thing. Very easy to make. Just mix 3 cups of cold water to 1 cup of soft server mix, through it into your ice cream machine and 30 minutes later you have delicious Dole Whip. Add some pineapple juice and you have perfection
customer_reviews.author: mahooga

customer_reviews.title: Good taste of pineapple.
customer_reviews.text: I was not overwhelmed with joy when I made this. I only made it once. The pineapple flavor was great, but the consistency was like glue. Perhaps if I had a frosty-freeze machine, it would have not gotten so glue-like. I made it in my Italian ice cream maker.
customer_reviews.author: Walden

customer_reviews.title: It's the real deal, but you need a calculator for home use
customer_reviews.text: The directions on the bag only show how to make a full batch. You'll need to convert for making smaller batches. In my case, I mixed 1 quart of chilled water and 300 grams. Put it into my ice-cream/frozen yogurt maker, and 20 minutes later dessert was ready
customer_reviews.author: Vince Pachiano

customer_reviews.title: This IS Dole Whip!
customer_reviews.text: Our family's favorite treat at Disney World is Dole Whip and this is the real deal. It doesn't "taste like" Dole Whip - it IS Dole Whip. We made it in our ice cream freezer and it was awesome. You might have to play with the ratio a little to get it the exact way you like it, but it take you back to Disney in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: HausManager

customer_reviews.title: Disney Comes Home
customer_reviews.text: It’s pricey but I think it lasts a while and who doesn’t want to bring a little Disney back home with them. You don’t need an ice cream maker. I followed the 1 cup of Mix to 2 cups of water recipe. I used the glass bowl for my Kitchen Aid Mixer I mixed the ingredients pop it in the freezer for a few hours and when I was ready to eat it-I just used th paddle attachment and whipped it for a few minutes to get a Smooth consistency. It’s awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Cheri Gerzabek

customer_reviews.title: Great treat
customer_reviews.text: I have a mr ice cream machine this works great in it wish they would give a recipe for small batch you would think if they sell this to families they would do that thanks amazon for selling this product I live about 40 minutes from Disney world but now I can enjoy at home and not pay 7dollars a serving.
customer_reviews.author: leta r parker

customer_reviews.title: Dolewhip Ice Cream at Home!!!
customer_reviews.text: Delicious! And so easy to make. I followed the directions at Pressureluckcooking.com and my Dolewhip ice cream came out perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Food of the gods
customer_reviews.text: Make your own Mouse-style Dole Whip at home! This stuff is delicious. Very easy to make. We actually heard about this product via a YouTube video that gives step-by-step for the entire process. The video also gives the mixing proportions for making single home size batches. Refreezes into more of a sorbet consistency. Still marvelous!
customer_reviews.author: D.Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Tasty Treat
customer_reviews.text: Use 8 oz of powder with 4 cups of water. We mix in the blender and let chill before putting in our ice cream maker. Sometimes we just mix a batch and use our Zoku Slushie maker to make individual Dole Whips. Also tasty if you add either pineapple or coconut rum for an adult version-add the alcohol after it's frozen to the consistency you prefer.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Real Deal
customer_reviews.text: 3 cups water, 1 cup mix in my simple ice cream maker for 30 minutes and bam I’ve got real deal Dole Whips! I have to say I like them better next day after being in the freezer overnight. I also put it from the ice cream machine into popsicle molds and they turned out great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: delicious
customer_reviews.text: I'm surprised at how fresh this tastes. It tastes like real pineapple. I like to mix up just half a bag at a time because I don't use it too much. And I like to add a quart of cream to that half bag - it makes for a very creamy and delicious DW
customer_reviews.author: Jared Bytheway

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The package was torn. The powder mix spilled all over.
customer_reviews.author: AdorableDNette

customer_reviews.title: Feels like I am back at Disney!
customer_reviews.text: All you need is an ice cream maker, water and this package of dole whip mix. Measure it out, mix it up and put the mixture in the ice cream maker for about 20-30 minutes. Taste exactly like what they serve in the parks! Also great if you add a little coconut malibu rum when served!
customer_reviews.author: Nikko Athena Saigo

customer_reviews.title: Yummy
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for personal home use. Needed to calculate the proportions for water to mix for a home soft serve machine. Tastes like the Dole Plantation Soft Serve we eat when in Hawaii! A little of island in a bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Island Flier

customer_reviews.title: Disney in a Glass !
customer_reviews.text: The perfect dole whip at home . I put mine in a Vintage Polynesian Village Tiki as a bowl of soft serve or floating on Dole pineapple juice and I am back at Disney World without the lines! Will be ordering by the case as this is very addicting.
customer_reviews.author: flasteelerfan

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy unless you own a soft serve machine.
customer_reviews.text: Can’t do anything with it without a soft serve machine, I thought it would work in an ice cream churn it doesn’t.
customer_reviews.author: Todd P.

customer_reviews.title: Tastes great. I love it
customer_reviews.text: Tastes great. I love it. If you have a small ice cream maker just read the comments and questions to know how much to use on them. If you like pineapples or even the some pineapple, then you will love this product. This is a for sure rebuy.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Sevilla

customer_reviews.title: Close your eyes and your in Disney World
customer_reviews.text: The exact stuff they have at Disney World. Good flavor and all you do is add water. I use 2 cups of water to 1 cup of powder for my 1 quart ice creamm maker. If you want to freeze this will end up like a sherbet but still good to eat.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Girl

customer_reviews.title: Just like the Dole Whips at DisneyWorld! Make them at home!
customer_reviews.text: This mix is amazing! I was skeptical at first, but ordered on the recommendations I read here on the site. I don't have a special soft serve ice cream maker, just a regular Cuisinart Ice Cream maker and my Dole Whips came out great, tasted just like the ones at DisneyWorld! It's a large bag of mix, really meant for a commercial machine, but they very nicely include instructions for smaller home machines. Just add water, and you have delicious Dole Whips at home. I'll be all set until I can get back to DisneyWorld, highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Lucygeorge

customer_reviews.title: Super yummy, reminding us of our Dole Whipat Disneyland!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use with my cuisinart ice cream maker. Tastes just like the Dole Whip we had in Disneyland! It is dairy free and fewer calories than our usual favorite ice cream recipe.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn S

customer_reviews.title: Super Easy
customer_reviews.text: The powder mixed easily with water using a whisk and the 4.4 lb bag worked perfectly in an 8 qt hand-crank ice cream maker. We're looking forward to truing the other flavors!
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen L. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Delicious
customer_reviews.text: I have previously purchased the regular dole whip and its yummy! This one is just as good depending on your mood i would make both so you have them when you want. I used my kitchenaid mixer ice cream attachment.
customer_reviews.author: johnathan m

customer_reviews.title: Delicious!!
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING!!!! Mix 1 cup soft serve powder into 3 cups cold water and put in ice cream maker for 25mins and voilà you have pineapple dole whip Disney-style!!! I like to put mine in the freezer after it’s done in ice cream maker in order to firm it up before serving, or you can eat it right after it’s done, either way is great... enjoy!!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Fowler

customer_reviews.title: I make Dole Whip in my VitaMix with this mix ...
customer_reviews.text: I make Dole Whip in my VitaMix with this mix. Ice, water (or milk) and powder. Mix for 30 seconds. Bliss.
customer_reviews.author: John F.

customer_reviews.title: Real Deal
customer_reviews.text: This is the actual stuff they serve at the house of mouse. Wife was thrilled. You will need an ice-cream machine to make it properly, be forewarned.
customer_reviews.author: Kengineer

customer_reviews.title: Yummy in my tummy
customer_reviews.text: No longer have to overpay at Disney for a yummy treat!! Fresh out of the maker its just like disney. Let it harden overnight in the freezer and its like a big stick popsicle (texture wise) and still delicious!!
customer_reviews.author: Ga4rd2en0er

customer_reviews.title: Just like Walt Disney World!
customer_reviews.text: Tastes like WDW! I used the Cuisinart 1.5qt Ice Cream Maker that I bought on Amazon. In a mixing bowl I combined 1.5cups 1% milk, 1 cup cold water and 1 cup Dole Mix. Whisked until mix was dissolved. Poured into prepared, running machine. I ran machine for 30 mins. It had the same consistency and tasted exactly like Dole Whip you buy in Disney World!
customer_reviews.author: Connie 1.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! Perfect made in small batches
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! Perfect made in small batches. Package only has the recipe for a large batch, but found a YouTube video which showed how to make smaller batches using the Cuisinart Ice Cream Maker. Yum!
customer_reviews.author: Judy Krygier

customer_reviews.title: Delicious
customer_reviews.text: Omg. If I could give 10 stars I would. First this package came quickly. Second the taste. I first had Dole whip in Hawaii at the Dole plantation. When I saw I could make this at home I was very excited. And I wasn’t disappointed !! Delicious!!
customer_reviews.author: Jazzspurs

customer_reviews.title: Dole Whips! It's the real deal!
customer_reviews.text: We use our kitchen aid ice cream maker to stir up this dairy free dish of delicious. Side note: you can add very small pieces of chopped up pineapple to add some fresh flavor!
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Tasting Soft Serve Ice Cream
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to make, takes about 30 minutes to make. Just add one cup of the mix and three cups of water, mix and add to the ice cream maker. I usually make up a batch and keep in the freezer. I am fond of using the ice cream in a gramcracker piecrust.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Keaton

customer_reviews.title: Dole Whip at home! Whats not to love!
customer_reviews.text: Dole whip at home! I've died and gone to Disneyland heaven! Its no tiki room on a hot summer day, but I'm so happy I ordered this! Its enough to feed a small village so scroll through these comments and find the recipe for a standard cuisinart ice cream maker and then make dole whip to your hearts content. yum
customer_reviews.author: Dhyana Colony

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Cent!!
customer_reviews.text: Received this today. Made a batch. I was back at Disney!! It is G-O-O-D!! Get this and your palate will be in great shape!! I’ll be getting more when this bag is finished!!
customer_reviews.author: David J

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with bag busted open
customer_reviews.text: The entire box was covered in lime powder. The bag was either broken before it was put in the box or broke in transit. Unfortunately, this item is not able to be returned or get a refund so I'm just out the $30. Very disappointed in this policy.
customer_reviews.author: L. Pod

customer_reviews.title: WASTE OF MONEY, WON'T FREEZE UP AND THEY WON'T TAKE RETURNS!!!
customer_reviews.text: The product won't freeze! It stays in a liquid state. DON'T BUY IT BECAUSE THEY WON'T TAKE RETURNS FOR THIS DEFECTIVE PRODUCT! WHAT A WASTE OF MY MONEY!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mocheen

customer_reviews.title: Delicious, but expires quickly
customer_reviews.text: We use this in a small, home ice cream maker and it's delicious! My 10 year old can easily make it by himself. The only negative is that it doesn't come in a non-commercial sized package, so it's going to expire long before we can use all of it.
customer_reviews.author: Nikilynn42

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is awesome, just like at the Dole Plantation on Oahu ...
customer_reviews.text: The real deal. This stuff is awesome, just like at the Dole Plantation on Oahu or at Disney. Just make sure you store the rest in the fridge so it doesn't spoil.
customer_reviews.author: A. Travis

customer_reviews.title: Delicious and easy
customer_reviews.text: Tastes just like the snacks they sell at everyone's favorite vacation destination in the Reedy Creek Improvement District of Central Florida. Easy to mix up and make in a countertop ice cream machine.
customer_reviews.author: Josh M.

customer_reviews.title: Not sure what to think...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this and received a pack that was expired. The seller took care of it and sent a new one. However, I found that the new one didn't really add any body when made in the ice cream maker - so we've got a batch of dole whip that is decidedly not soft-serve. Once we're through this, we will try again - maybe it was just that batch...
customer_reviews.author: Chris B Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Tastes Great
customer_reviews.text: Tastes great with our home ice cream maker. Wish it was resealable, but realize this is a commercial type package.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy

customer_reviews.title: This an awesome and delicious treat
customer_reviews.text: This an awesome and delicious treat. The fact that it is dairy free means no rumbling belly this summer. In order to use it in a frozen yogurt machine, you just have to cut the amount down. I use a cup of the powder to two or three cups cold water depending on how sweet you like it. I do not have a soft serve machine so no need to use the whole bag at once. I just make the amount I want and garnish it with frozen pineapple chunks. Light and fluffy desert great for the whole family. Awesome product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The treat you’ve been dreaming about since vacation
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is great and exactly the pineapple treat you get at WDW. I like to amp up the creaminess by adding a bit of half and half to the mix along with water. I use an ice cream maker with a condenser...so self cooling and it comes out very similar to the original in texture.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda

customer_reviews.title: Yummy
customer_reviews.text: I add pineapple chunks toward the end of mixing in the ice cream maker. Nice and refreshing. Everyone likes it.
customer_reviews.author: DeeBee

product_meta.title: Dole Soft Serve Mix, Pineapple, 4.40 Pound
product_meta.description:
Flavor:pineapple| Size:4.40 Pound (Pack of 1)Specifications:

 * Servings: 89 servings - 1/2 cup portions (when mixed with 2 liquid gallons)
 * Flavor: Pineapple
 * Available Flavors: Lemon, Mango, Orange, Pineapple, Raspberry, and Strawberry
 * Shelf Life: 12 months in dry state
 * Dairy and Gluten FREE
 * Unit Sold By: Bag (4.4 lbs)


Ingredients:Sugar, Dextrose, Stabilizers (Cellulose Gum, Xanthan Gum, Locust Bean Gum, Guar Gum, Karaya Gum, Pectin), Coconut Oil, Contains 2% Or Less Of Each Of The Following: Maltodextrin, Citric Acid, Natural & Artificial Flavor (contains Pineapple Juice Powder), Modified Food Starch, Malic Acid, Beta Carotene (Color), Mono & Diglycerides, Silicon Dioxide (Anticaking).
feature_bullets: Dole Soft Serve Mix - Pineapple (4.4 lbs), P7714

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
